name: domaine de la Cotelleraie (red)
description:
wiine.me is the best Swiss Wine by Subscription service in Switzerland to discover & learn about new wines selected by experts and specialists every month and directly at home !

Discover this great cabernet franc

Information sheet :
Domaine de la Cotelleraie 2011
AOC: Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueuil, Loire, France 
Color: Red
Vintage: 2011
Grape variety: 100% Cabernet franc

Wine produced from organic grapes

Appearance:

A deep ruby red color with a slight brightness.

Nose:
This Cabernet franc has red fruits aromas and a floral fruity note. We recognize a light smell of green pepper.


Palate:
In the mouth, the wine has personality with silky tannins ending with a smooth and delicate note. A full-bodied but subtle wine. A Cabernet franc that goes over the prejudices about the rustic character of his peers!

Wine and food matches:
Serve it between 16°–18°C. It will perfectly accompany your chicken with cream or a vegetable tart.

When should I drink this wine?
It is to be drunk from today and can age 2-3 years.

Why did we choose it? 
It is a typical Cabernet franc of the Loire, a large but little known wine making region. Gérald Vallée, its owner, works in his vineyards but also during the vinification. It is an ideal wine to understand the cabernets francs from the Loire and continue our journey across the different productions of the world. 

The domain:
The Vallée family has her roots in the wine making lands of Saint Nicolas de Bourgueil since several centuries. This family passes the Domaine de la Cotelleraie from one generation to the next. Across 26 hectares, the vineyards occupy every level of the landscape: the gravels of the terrace, the siliceous limestones of the low hill and the clay gravel hills of the Loire Valley. 
The domain has an organic certification. Gérald Vallée works the ground with respect for the nature so as to get the best of the grapes, thus making a name for himself in the appellation Saint Nicolas de Bourgueil.

name: Proyecto Cu4tro (white)
description:
Information sheet :
Proyecto Cu4tro
AOC: Catalunya
Color: White
Vintage: 2011
Grape varieties: Macabeo 54%, Parellada 40%, Xarello 6%, Grenache blanc 1%


Appearance:
Bright with glints of green.

Nose:
Crispy aromas of fruits. Exotic and herbaceous.

Palate:
In the mouth, the acidity gives a nice freshness. The wine is well made and has a good balance between body and acidity. Pleasant final notes.

Wine and food matches:
It is to be drunk for the aperitif and with shellfish and sea food. It would be perfect with tapas and galician octopus.

When should I drink this wine?
This wine is to be drunk during the year in order to enjoy its freshness. Serve it ideally between 10° and 12°.

Why did we choose it?
It is a pleasant wine that gives us the occasion to make you discover a new region and new grape varieties. It is also a wine to drink during the summer. Opportunity makes the thief!

The domain:
A combination between tradition and modernism. The Clos Mont Blanc domain that produces this vintage is one symbol of this revival in the Catalan production. This mixture gives us wines like this one combining traditional regional grape varieties with the most advanced techniques of vinification.

name: Grignolino d’Asti (red)
description:
Grignolino d’Asti del Casot, L. Ferraris 2011
AOC: Grignolino d’Asti DOC
Color: Red
Vintage: 2011
Grape variety: Grignolino

Appearance :
This wine has a ruby red color with a nice transparency and luminosity. 

Nose :
Fine, intense and ethereal bouquets with notes of wild cherry, undergrowth and licorice

Palate:
It is dry and has a nice coolness. A slightly bitter and persistent aftertaste follows. It is a medium structured and long tasting wine. A wine of its own but definitively interesting! 

Wine and food matches:
It is an iconoclastic wine that can especially accompany fish or Italian pasta. It is to be drunk generally with a light to a medium fat dish. To serve between 16° and 18°.

When should I drink this wine?
This wine is to be drunk as from today and in the next 5 years.

Why did we choose it?
This wine enables us to discover a typical product from the region of Asti. It is produced from a grape variety that has almost disappeared. It was indeed one of the greatest Italian wine until an epidemic decimated almost all its representatives. It has been preserved and brought back to production by some young producers of the Piedmont. It is a very nice opportunity to discover a grape variety that has almost been forgotten.

The domain:
The 10-hectares domain of Luca Ferraris is situated at the northeast of Asti. It is a family propriety since 1921. Luca Ferraris bought plots and patiently rebuilt a domain so as to plant indigenous grape varieties but also Syrah and Viognier. Although he has a passion for sustainable agriculture, Lucas does not hesitate to introduce the most modern techniques. This global vision enables him to produce accomplished wine with style.

name: Tierra de Luna blanco (white)
description:
wiine.me is the best Swiss Wine by Subscription service in Switzerland to discover & learn about new wines selected by experts and specialists every month and directly at home !

Simply made it’s wine by subscription

Information sheet :
Tierra de Luna blanc 2011
AOC: Vallée de Uco, Argentina
Color: White
Vintage: 2011
Grape varieties: 50% Torrontes – 50% Chardonnay


Appearance:
The wine is clear and has a golden color with green reflections.

Nose:
The Chardonnay brings fullness and smoothness. The Torrontes is present with its hints of white and muscat flowers. Some people also found hints of tarragon in this bouquet of wine, you too ? 

Palate:
It is a fresh wine easy to drink. Its sour balance gives lightness and a tasty palate. It is « fat » in the mouth. 

Wine and food matches:
It is to be drunk for the aperitif and with shellfish and sea food. And why not with sushis ?!

When should I drink this wine?
You should drink it during the year in order to enjoy its freshness. Serve it ideally between 8° and 12°.

Why did we choose it?
It is a simple wine that gives the opportunity to discover this new grape variety, the Torrontes, like a new letter in your oenological alphabet!

The domain:
Situated in the Mendoza province, the vineyards that produce the grapes of this Tierra de Luna are planted in a semi-desert zone, with a " grey ground ". It is volcanic moraine. These extreme conditions require from the plants the best of themselves. The result is grapes that express themselves with distinctive aromas in the glass. It is an excellent method to identify the characteristics of the vines that are produced.

Information sheet : 
Tierra de Luna Tinto 2011
AOC: Medoza, Argentine
Color: Rouge
Vintage: 2011
Grape Varieties: 80 % Syrah – 20 % Malbec

Appearance:
Intense ruby red color. The wine does not leave many tears down the inside of the glass. This shows that the wine has a low alcohol content and is not too « fat ».

Nose:
Aromas of red fruit, sublte hints of spicies (particular to the Syrah) and floral notes. 

Palate:
This wine is caracterized by the sweetness of the tannins and the spicy aromas of Syrah. The caracteristic notes of Malbec, red fruits grown in warm sectors, persist until the end. The wine is both rich and soft, a delight !

Wine and food matches:
It is an ideal wine for the first barbecues and, for example, a nice grilled piece of red meat!

When should I drink this wine?
This wine is to be drunk as from today. Serve it chilled, between 16° and 18°. It will heat up in the glass if necessary.

Why did we choose it?
Since more than a century the region of Mendoza in Argentina has been producing wines with French grape varieties as Syrah and Malbec. Today, we find wines with a good value for money and we think that this wine is part of them.

The domain:
Situated in the province of Mendoza, the vineyards that produce the grapes of this Tierra de Luna are planted in a semi-desert zone, with a " grey ground ". It is volcanic moraine. These extreme conditions require from the plants the best of themselves. The result is grapes that express themselves with distinctive aromas in the glass. It is an excellent method to identify the characteristics of the vines that are produced.
